content.text:
# Outer Critics Circle Award for Outstanding Orchestrations

| website       = [http://www.outercriticscircle.org OuterCriticsCircle.org]
}}
The Outer Critics Circle Award for Outstanding Orchestrations is an honor presented at the Outer Critics Circle Awards, a ceremony established in 1950 for excellence in orchestrations on Broadway and Off-Broadway productions, to orchestrators of any production. The category was added to the ceremony in 2017.
Michael Starobin has been nominated the most, with three nominations, while no orchestrator has won the award more than once.
